entry.title: The Complex But Awesome CSS border-image Property
entry.summary: The CSS `border-image` property is one of those properties you undoubtedly know exists but may not have ever reached for. In this article, Temani Afif demonstrates different approaches for using `border-image` to create clever decorative accents and shapes.

entry.title: Top Front-End Tools Of 2023
entry.summary: Useful front-end tools for CSS and JavaScript developers that were most popular last year and will help you speed up your development workflow. Let’s dive in!

entry.title: SolidStart: A Different Breed Of Meta-Framework
entry.summary: Are you ready for a little exercise of pulling a framework apart and putting the pieces back together? In this article, Atila Fassina explains how meta-frameworks have evolved around core libraries in their own unique ways.

entry.title: The View Transitions API And Delightful UI Animations (Part 2)
entry.summary: The View Transitions API is a new — but game-changing — feature that allows us to do the types of reactive state-based UI and page transitions that have traditionally been exclusive to JavaScript frameworks. In the second half of this mini two-part series, Adrian Bece expands on the demos from the first article to demonstrate how the View Transitions API can be used to transition not just elements between two states but the transition between full views and pages in single-page and multi-page applications.

entry.title: The Magic Of New Beginnings (January 2024 Wallpapers Edition)
entry.summary: Let’s start into the new year with a little inspiration boost: wallpapers created with love by the community for the community. Happy 2024!

entry.title: Making Sense Of “Senseless” JavaScript Features
entry.summary: JavaScript may be the most popular client-side language in the world, but it’s far from perfect and not without its quirks. Juan Diego Rodriguez examines several “absurd” JavaScript eccentricities and explains how they made it into the language as well as how to avoid them in your own code.

entry.title: The View Transitions API And Delightful UI Animations (Part 1)
entry.summary: The View Transitions API is a new — but game-changing — feature that allows us to do the types of reactive state-based UI and page transitions that have traditionally been exclusive to JavaScript frameworks. In the first part of this mini two-part series, Adrian Bece thoroughly explains why we need the API and demonstrates its basic usage.
